alert.note: Alert for Anderson (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 04 at 11:45AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following counties, Anderson and Pickens. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EST. * IMPACTS...River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1143 AM EST, Gauge reports that creeks and rivers remain elevated, so be aware of the continued threat of flooding of low-lying areas along Twelve and Eighteen Mile Creeks. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clemson, Central, Pendleton, Liberty, Norris, Lake Hartwell and Sandy Springs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
